title.narrative: 5.2 EQUITY-BASED POLICIES & FRAMEWORKS

description.narrative: By 2016, national capacity is increased to plan, budget and track evidence informed and equity-based social policies and budget allocations for the most deprived children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Economic And Social Policy General, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Knowledge on the situation and rights of children among stakeholders and duty â€“bearers generated to guide implementation of CRC, policy formulation, social sectors' strategies and budget allocations for increased social spending on national programmes that improve realization of the rights of children within the lowest wealth quintile.

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Social and behaviour change communication on violence, exploitation and abuse

description.narrative: General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs policy, planning and administration
Justice, Law and Order human rights affairs

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, national capacity is increased to plan, budget and track evidence informed and equity-based social policies and budgetallocations for the most deprived children.

description.narrative: First report on child-focused budgeting launched and endorsed by Government X analyzing trends in social-sector expenditure benefitting children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2016
